2. Dual Numbers Class¶

This section covers the implementation and methods of the Dual class, which is used to handle dual numbers and perform automatic differentiation.

class dual_autodiff.dual.Dual(real, dual)¶

Bases: object

A class that defines a structure for dual numbers and performs standards operations on them.

real¶

real part of the number.

dual¶

dual part of the number.

__add__(x)¶

Redefines the + operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to add to our current instance.

Returns

the result of the addition of the current instance and the input (dual number or scalar)

Return type

Dual number

__eq__(x)¶

Redefines the == operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar we want to compare the current instance to.

Returns

True if the current instance and input are equal

False if the current instance and input are not equal

Return type

Bool

__floordiv__(x)¶

Redefines the // operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to divide our current instance with.

Returns

the result of the floor division between the current instance and the input (dual number or scalar).

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If division by zero is attempted.

__iadd__(x)¶

Redefines the += operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to add to our current instance.

Returns

the result of the addition of the current instance and the input (dual number or scalar)

Return type

Dual number

__ifloordiv__(x)¶

Redefines the //= operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to divide our current instance with.

Returns

the result of the floor division between the current instance and the input (dual number or scalar).

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If division by zero is attempted.

__imod__(x)¶

Redefines the %= operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to compute the modulus with.

Returns

the result of the modulus operation.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If modulus by zero is attempted.

__imul__(x)¶

Redefines the *= operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to multiply our current instance with.

Returns

the result of the multiplication between the input (dual number or scalar) and the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__ipow__(power)¶

Redefines the **= operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the power to which we want to raise the current instance.

Returns

the current instance raised to the power of the input.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If the power is a dual number.

__isub__(x)¶

Redefines the -= operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to subtract from our current instance.

Returns

the result of the subtraction of the input (dual number or scalar) from the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__itruediv__(x)¶

Redefines the /= operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to divide our current instance with.

Returns

the result of dividing the current instance by the input (dual number or scalar).

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If division by zero is attempted.

__mod__(x)¶

Redefines the % operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to compute the modulus with.

Returns

the result of the modulus operation.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If modulus by zero is attempted.

__mul__(x)¶

Redefines the * operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to multiply our current instance with.

Returns

the result of the multiplication between the input (dual number or scalar) and the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__ne__(x)¶

Redefines the != operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar we want to compare the current instance to.

Returns

True if the current instance and input are not equal

False if the current instance and input are equal

Return type

Bool

__neg__()¶

Redefines the - operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Returns

the negation of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__pow__(power)¶

Redefines the ** operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the power to which we want to raise the current instance.

Returns

the current instance raised to the power of the input.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If the power is a dual number.

__radd__(x)¶

Redefines the reverse + operator to adapt it to dual numbers. Considers the case where we have :scalar+dual number

Parameters

x – the scalar to add to our current instance.

Returns

the result of the addition of the scalar and the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__rfloordiv__(x)¶

Redefines the reverse // operator to adapt it to dual numbers. Considers the case where we have: scalar//dual number

Parameters

x – the scalar that is the numerator of the division.

Returns

the result of the floor division between the scalar and a dual number.

Return type

dual number

__rmod__(x)¶

Redefines the reverse % operator to adapt it to dual numbers. Considers the case where we have: scalar%dual number

Parameters

x – the scalar to compute the modulus with.

Returns

the result of the modulus operation.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If modulus by zero is attempted.

__rsub__(x)¶

Redefines the reverse - operator to adapt it to dual numbers. Considers the case where we have :scalar-dual number

Parameters

x – the scalar to add to our current instance.

Returns

the result of the subtraction of the scalar and the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__rtruediv__(x)¶

Redefines the reverse / operator to adapt it to dual numbers. Considers the case where we have: scalar/dual number

Parameters

x – the scalar that is the numerator of the division.

Returns

the result of dividing the scalar by a dual number.

Return type

Dual number

__str__()¶

Redefines the readable string form of the class to get the desired output when we use print the dual number.

Returns

in the form “Dual(real=number.real, dual=number.dual) “

Return type

String

__sub__(x)¶

Redefines the - operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to subtract from our current instance.

Returns

the result of the subtraction of the input (dual number or scalar) from the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

__truediv__(x)¶

Redefines the / operator to adapt it to dual numbers.

Parameters

x – the dual number or scalar to divide our current instance with.

Returns

the result of dividing the current instance by the input (dual number or scalar).

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – If division by zero is attempted.

ceil()¶

Computes the ceil of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the ceil of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the ceil of the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

cos()¶

Computes the cosine function of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the cosine function of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the cosine function evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

exp()¶

Computes the exponential function of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the exp of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the exp evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

floor()¶

Computes the floor of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the floor of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the floor of the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

inverse()¶

Computes the inverse of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the inverse of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the inverse evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – if the real part of the instance is 0; division by 0 is an error.

log()¶

Computes the logarithm function of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the log of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the log evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – if the real part of the instance is 0; division by 0 is an error.

sin()¶

Computes the sine function of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the reult is the sine function of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the sine function evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

square()¶

Computes the square of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the square of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the square function evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

tan()¶

Computes the tangent function of the dual number.

Returns

The real part of the result is the tangent function of the real part of the current instance. The dual part of the result is the derivative of the tangent function evaluated at the real part of the current instance multiplied with the dual part of the current instance.

Return type

Dual number

Raises

Warning – if the cosine of the real part is 0; division by 0 is an error.
